text:
SPEAKER 1: So can just
reflect on your outside India,

and going international, how
that started, why it started?

ANAND BURMAN: Well, we were
always sending products

to the Middle East, and
to various geographies
around India, yeah?

So we have a very active
presence in Nepal.

We have a very active
presence in Bangladesh.

And wherever the Indian
diaspora has gotten to,
we have some kind of a presence.

So if you were to
go into the US,

and go to any of the
ethnic food stores,

you will always find
a product over there.

Whether it's Pudina, or
whether it's Hajmola,
whether it's Chyawanprash.

SPEAKER 1: We buy
it all the time.
ANAND BURMAN: There we go.

[LAUGHS] So we have a very
active presence in that.

That has been going on
for several decades.

Because the Indian
diaspora want for that.

And how those products got
to them in the earlier years
was through unorganized trade.
Same thing in the Middle East.
Huge Indian diaspora over there.

So they wanted a lot of
our personal care products.

So we started pushing our
personal care products
over there.

Again, as an export
out of India, yeah.

Then, we set up our
first overseas plant

at the Jebel Ali Free
Trade Zone, in Dubai.
Yeah?

And we started introducing
more and more and more personal

care products within
that umbrella.
We started advertising.

Then the whole thing spread
from the Indian diaspora,
to even the local population.

It was very, very
heartening to see that.

So one of our most
successful products
was Dabur Amla Hair Oil.
Yeah?

And I was at a party,
at a social dinner.

And I didn't know who this lady
was, but she was an Arab lady.
And somebody asked her.

He said, look, your
hair is beautiful.
What do you use for your hair?

She says, I use a product
called Dabur Amla.

That made me feel
so good, you know?

That plant went from
strength to strength.

And that overseas
business of ours

really has gone from
strength to strength.

Till as of today, we
have about one third

of our revenues
coming from overseas.

And because of
logistical concerns,

we decided to set
up plants locally,
to service those markets.

So today we have
a plant in Nepal.
We have a plant in Sri Lanka.
We have a plant in Bangladesh.

We have a very large
manufacturing facility

in the Emirate of
Ras Al Khaimah, which

supplies a lot of the
personal care products
into the Middle East.

Whether it's Saudi,
whether it's Kuwait.

We have a very successful
facility in Egypt, in Turkey,
in Nigeria.

We've just opened one small
facility in South Africa.

So we pretty much are all over
this thing like a good rash.
[LAUGHS]
